message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CY

This paper proposes a method for measuring semantic similarity between texts in different languages, which is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science. The most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), as the paper deals with natural language processing and cross-lingual information retrieval. The use of word embeddings and alignment also suggests a connection to cs.LG (Machine Learning), while the unsupervised nature of the approach could fit into cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions plagiarism detection, which falls under cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and the use of bilingual embeddings could be relevant to cs.CY (Computers and Society) in terms of promoting cross-cultural communication.
